document.masterDocTitle: Review of the genus Siemssenius Weise, 1922 (Coleoptera: Chrysomelidae: Galerucinae) from Taiwan, with descriptions of five new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Review of the genus Siemssenius Weise, 1922 (Coleoptera: Chrysomelidae: Galerucinae) from Taiwan, with descriptions of five new species

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Type locality.
Chiayi county , Alishan (阿里山), 23°30’32”N , 120°48’07”E ,
2200 m
.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 9. Diagnostic characters of
Siemssenius rufipennis
(Chûjô, 1962)
. 9A. Antenna, male; 9B. Antenna, female; 9C. Penis, lateral view; 9D. Penis, dorsal view; 9E. Abdominal ventrites III–V, male; 9F. Abdominal ventrite V, female; 9G. Abdominal tergite VIII, female; 9H. Abdominal ventrite VIII, female; 9I. Spermatheca.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Description. Aedeagus concave and wide, sides parallel; apico-lateral angles obtusely angulate, wide in lateral view, bases of apico-lateral angles moderately arcuate; middle of apical margin with a long, broad tube-like process, slender in lateral view, apex deeply and medially depressed; dorsal process subapically and strongly curved in lateral view, but slightly widened in dorsal view, apex pointed in dorsal and lateral views ( Figs. 9 C–9D). Ventrite V ( Fig. 9 F) not modified in female, apical margin slightly sinuate. Gonocoxae reduced. Ventrite VIII ( Fig. 9 H) heart-shaped, with extremely short spiculum, with sparse, elongate setae along apical margins of triangulate processes. Tergite VIII ( Fig. 9 G) with apex pointed, with sparse setae on disc. Receptacle of spermatheca (
Fig. 9
I) weakly swollen, barely separated from pump, pump much narrower and longer, sharply curved; proximal spermathecal duct short and broad.

Diagnosis.
Siemssenius rufipennis
can be separated from other members of the species group by the combination of the following characters: the moderately arcuate bases of apico-lateral angles (smooth bases in
S. jungchani
sp. nov.
( Fig. 7 A) and
S. yuae
sp. nov.
( Fig. 11 A); sharply arcuate bases in
S. tsoui
sp. nov.
( Fig. 10 A)) and long median tube-like process of the apical margin (extremely short process in
S. liui
sp. nov.
( Figs 8 A–8B)) of the aedeagus ( Figs 9 A–9B).

Host plants.
Lonicera acuminata Wall., 1832
( Caprifoliaceae );
Hypericum nagasawae Hayata, 1911 (Guttiferae)
.
Distribution. Widespread in central Taiwan ( Chiayi , Hualien , Nantou , and Taichung conties) ( Fig. 4 ).
